February 19, 2021

Cabinets, Part V

By Joseph Kibe

Finally, the cabinets are ordered. But the pandemic strikes again: the final delivery window is 14 to 18 weeks. I’m hoping it will be possible to get the work started sooner. There’s a lot of demolition and construction that needs to happen before the cabinets go in. Then again, from what I hear, it may also be difficult to book a contractor.

Continue reading →

January 30, 2021

Cabinets, Part IV

By Joseph Kibe

Getting a final specification for the cabinets has been quite a journey. Never would I have guessed it would be so difficult to do something as simple as pick out how to arrange drawers. But after several weeks — plus a break for Christmas and New Year — I have a final layout, down to which drawers go where. There’s also been some interesting back and forth about what to do behind the new kitchen.

Continue reading →

December 13, 2020

Cabinets, Part III

By Joseph Kibe

Before spending upwards of $10,000 on something, it’s worth taking the time to see what you’re buying in person. Or at least to the extent possible in current circumstances. If it were easier to travel, I probably would have made a trip down to New York to look at complete kitchens made with Reform’s cabinet system. I’ve chosen to settle for more pandemic-friendly samples.

Continue reading →
